channel.title: Open Source Directions hosted by OpenTeams
channel.description: Bringing you the news about the future of Open Source
channel.itunes:author: Quansight, LLC
channel.itunes:subtitle: Bringing you the news about the future of Open Source

item.title: Episode 40: Fortran
item.dc:creator: info@quansight.com (Quansight, LLC)
item.content:encoded:
Fortran is a compiled language which means that once written, the source code must be passed through a compiler to produce a machine executable that can be run.

Listen to the Episode!

Download
item.description: Fortran is a compiled language which means that once written, the source code must be passed through a compiler to produce a machine executable that can be run.
item.itunes:subtitle: A high-performance parallel programming language for STEM
item.itunes:author: Quansight, LLC
item.itunes:summary: Fortran is a compiled language which means that once written, the source code must be passed through a compiler to produce a machine executable that can be run.

item.title: Episode 39: Apache Arrow
item.dc:creator: info@quansight.com (Quansight, LLC)
item.content:encoded:
Apache Arrow is a cross-language development platform for in-memory data. It supports zero-copy streaming messaging and has support for a number of languages, including C, C++, Python, R, Rust, and many others.

Listen to the Episode!

Download
item.description: Apache Arrow is a cross-language development platform for in-memory data. It supports zero-copy streaming messaging and has support for a number of languages, including C, C++, Python, R, Rust, and many others.
item.itunes:subtitle: A cross-language development platform for in-memory data
item.itunes:author: Quansight, LLC
item.itunes:summary: Apache Arrow is a cross-language development platform for in-memory data. It supports zero-copy streaming messaging and has support for a number of languages, including C, C++, Python, R, Rust, and many others.

item.title: Episode 38: Jupyter Book
item.dc:creator: info@quansight.com (Quansight, LLC)
item.content:encoded:
Jupyter Book lets you build an online book using a collection of Jupyter Notebooks and Markdown files. Its output is similar to the excellent Bookdown tool, and adds extra functionality for people running a Jupyter stack.

Listen to the Episode!

Download
item.description: Jupyter Book lets you build an online book using a collection of Jupyter Notebooks and Markdown files. Its output is similar to the excellent Bookdown tool, and adds extra functionality for people running a Jupyter stack.
item.itunes:subtitle: Create an online book with Jupyter Notebooks and Jekyll
item.itunes:author: Quansight, LLC
item.itunes:summary: Jupyter Book lets you build an online book using a collection of Jupyter Notebooks and Markdown files. Its output is similar to the excellent Bookdown tool, and adds extra functionality for people running a Jupyter stack.

item.title: Episode 37: PyJanitor
item.dc:creator: info@quansight.com (Quansight, LLC)
item.content:encoded:
Originally a port of the R package, pyjanitor has evolved from a set of convenient data cleaning routines into an experiment with the method chaining paradigm. Data preprocessing usually consists of a series of steps that involve transforming raw data into an understandable/usable format.

Listen to the Episode!

Download
item.description: Originally a port of the R package, pyjanitor has evolved from a set of convenient data cleaning routines into an experiment with the method chaining paradigm. Data preprocessing usually consists of a series of steps that involve transforming raw data into an understandable/usable format.
item.itunes:subtitle: Extending Pandas with a verb-based API
item.itunes:author: Quansight, LLC
item.itunes:summary: Originally a port of the R package, pyjanitor has evolved from a set of convenient data cleaning routines into an experiment with the method chaining paradigm. Data preprocessing usually consists of a series of steps that involve transforming raw data into an understandable/usable format.

item.title: Episode 36: Bokeh 2.0
item.dc:creator: info@quansight.com (Quansight, LLC)
item.content:encoded:
Bokeh is an interactive visualization library for modern web browsers. It provides elegant, concise construction of versatile graphics, and affords high-performance interactivity over large or streaming datasets. Bokeh can help anyone who would like to quickly and easily make interactive plots, dashboards, and data applications. This is our second time visiting Bokeh, in preperation for the v2.0 release!

Listen to the Episode!

Download
item.description:
Bokeh is an interactive visualization library for modern web browsers. It provides elegant, concise construction of versatile graphics, and affords high-performance interactivity over large or streaming datasets. Bokeh can help anyone who would like to quickly and easily make interactive plots, dashboards, and data applications.
This is our second time visiting Bokeh, in preperation for the v2.0 release!
item.itunes:subtitle: Interactive visualization library for modern web browsers
item.itunes:author: Quansight, LLC
item.itunes:summary:
Bokeh is an interactive visualization library for modern web browsers. It provides elegant, concise construction of versatile graphics, and affords high-performance interactivity over large or streaming datasets. Bokeh can help anyone who would like to quickly and easily make interactive plots, dashboards, and data applications.
This is our second time visiting Bokeh, in preperation for the v2.0 release!

item.title: Episode 35: IBM Lale
item.dc:creator: info@quansight.com (Quansight, LLC)
item.content:encoded:
Lale is a Python library for semi-automated data science. Lale makes it easy to automatically select algorithms and tune hyperparameters of pipelines that are compatible with scikit-learn, in a type-safe fashion. If you are a data scientist who wants to experiment with automated machine learning, this library is for you! Lale adds value beyond scikit-learn along three dimensions: automation, correctness checks, and interoperability. For automation, Lale provides a consistent high-level interface to existing pipeline search tools including GridSearchCV, SMAC, and Hyperopt. For correctness checks, Lale uses JSON Schema to catch mistakes when there is a mismatch between hyperparameters and their type, or between data and operators. And for interoperability, Lale has a growing library of transformers and estimators from popular libraries such as scikit-learn, XGBoost, PyTorch etc. Lale can be installed just like any other Python package and can be edited with off-the-shelf Python tools such as Jupyter notebooks.

Listen to the Episode!

Download

Lale makes it easy to automatically select algorithms and tune hyperparameters of pipelines that are compatible with scikit-learn, in a type-safe fashion. If you are a data scientist who wants to experiment with automated machine learning, this library is for you! Lale adds value beyond scikit-learn along three dimensions: automation, correctness checks, and interoperability. For automation, Lale provides a consistent high-level interface to existing pipeline search tools including GridSearchCV, SMAC, and Hyperopt. For correctness checks, Lale uses JSON Schema to catch mistakes when there is a mismatch between hyperparameters and their type, or between data and operators. And for interoperability, Lale has a growing library of transformers and estimators from popular libraries such as scikit-learn, XGBoost, PyTorch etc. Lale can be installed just like any other Python package and can be edited with off-the-shelf Python tools such as Jupyter notebooks.

Lale makes it easy to automatically select algorithms and tune hyperparameters of pipelines that are compatible with scikit-learn, in a type-safe fashion. If you are a data scientist who wants to experiment with automated machine learning, this library is for you! Lale adds value beyond scikit-learn along three dimensions: automation, correctness checks, and interoperability. For automation, Lale provides a consistent high-level interface to existing pipeline search tools including GridSearchCV, SMAC, and Hyperopt. For correctness checks, Lale uses JSON Schema to catch mistakes when there is a mismatch between hyperparameters and their type, or between data and operators. And for interoperability, Lale has a growing library of transformers and estimators from popular libraries such as scikit-learn, XGBoost, PyTorch etc. Lale can be installed just like any other Python package and can be edited with off-the-shelf Python tools such as Jupyter notebooks.

item.title: Episode 34: Stumpy
item.dc:creator: info@quansight.com (Quansight, LLC)
item.content:encoded:
STUMPY is a powerful and scalable library that efficiently computes something called the matrix profile, which can be used for a variety of time series data mining tasks such as: pattern/motif (approximately repeated subsequences within a longer time series) discovery, anomaly/novelty (discord) discovery, shapelet discovery, semantic segmentation, density estimation, time series chains (temporally ordered set of subsequence patterns), and more!

Listen to the Episode!

Download
item.description: STUMPY is a powerful and scalable library that efficiently computes something called the matrix profile, which can be used for a variety of time series data mining tasks such as: pattern/motif (approximately repeated subsequences within a longer time series) discovery, anomaly/novelty (discord) discovery, shapelet discovery, semantic segmentation, density estimation, time series chains (temporally ordered set of subsequence patterns), and more!
item.itunes:subtitle: A powerful and scalable library that efficiently computes matrix profiles
item.itunes:author: Quansight, LLC
item.itunes:summary: STUMPY is a powerful and scalable library that efficiently computes something called the matrix profile, which can be used for a variety of time series data mining tasks such as: pattern/motif (approximately repeated subsequences within a longer time series) discovery, anomaly/novelty (discord) discovery, shapelet discovery, semantic segmentation, density estimation, time series chains (temporally ordered set of subsequence patterns), and more!

item.title: Episode 33: stdlib
item.dc:creator: info@quansight.com (Quansight, LLC)
item.content:encoded:
stdlib ("standard lib") is a standard library for JavaScript and Node.js, with an emphasis on numerical and scientific computing applications. The library provides a collection of robust, high performance libraries for mathematics, statistics, data processing, streams, and more and includes many of the utilities you would expect from a standard library.

Listen to the Episode!

Download
item.description: stdlib ("standard lib") is a standard library for JavaScript and Node.js, with an emphasis on numerical and scientific computing applications. The library provides a collection of robust, high performance libraries for mathematics, statistics, data processing, streams, and more and includes many of the utilities you would expect from a standard library.
item.itunes:subtitle: The Standard library for JavaScript
item.itunes:author: Quansight, LLC

The library provides a collection of robust, high performance libraries for mathematics, statistics, data processing, streams, and more and includes many of the utilities you would expect from a standard library.

item.title: Episode 32: Voila
item.dc:creator: info@quansight.com (Quansight, LLC)
item.content:encoded:
Voilà turns Jupyter notebooks into standalone web applications. Unlike the usual HTML-converted notebooks, each user connecting to the Voilà tornado application gets a dedicated Jupyter kernel which can execute the callbacks to changes in Jupyter interactive widgets. By default, Voilà disallows execute requests from the front-end, preventing execution of arbitrary code. By default, Voilà runs with the strip_source option, which strips out the input cells from the rendered notebook.

Listen to the Episode!

Download
item.description:
Voilà turns Jupyter notebooks into standalone web applications.
Unlike the usual HTML-converted notebooks, each user connecting to the Voilà tornado application gets a dedicated Jupyter kernel which can execute the callbacks to changes in Jupyter interactive widgets.
By default, Voilà disallows execute requests from the front-end, preventing execution of arbitrary code. By default, Voilà runs with the strip_source option, which strips out the input cells from the rendered notebook.
item.itunes:subtitle: Turns Jupyter notebooks into standalone web applications
item.itunes:author: Quansight, LLC
item.itunes:summary:
Voilà turns Jupyter notebooks into standalone web applications.
Unlike the usual HTML-converted notebooks, each user connecting to the Voilà tornado application gets a dedicated Jupyter kernel which can execute the callbacks to changes in Jupyter interactive widgets.
By default, Voilà disallows execute requests from the front-end, preventing execution of arbitrary code. By default, Voilà runs with the strip_source option, which strips out the input cells from the rendered notebook.

item.title: Episode 31: Econ-ARK
item.dc:creator: info@quansight.com (Quansight, LLC)
item.content:encoded:
The Econ-ARK project provides open-source toolkits for researchers trying to understand how economic and social outcomes result from the actions of heterogeneous individuals. The primary goals of the project are to make entry into the world of such modeling easy; to accelerate the development of this kind of modeling for policy-making and academic research; and to increase the openness, replicability, and interoperability of modeling tools.

Listen to the Episode!

Download
item.description:
The Econ-ARK project provides open-source toolkits for researchers trying to understand how economic and social outcomes result from the actions of heterogeneous individuals.
The primary goals of the project are to make entry into the world of such modeling easy; to accelerate the development of this kind of modeling for policy-making and academic research; and to increase the openness, replicability, and interoperability of modeling tools.
item.itunes:subtitle: A toolkit for structural modeling of economic choices
item.itunes:author: Quansight, LLC

item.title: Episode 30: UMAP
item.dc:creator: info@quansight.com (Quansight, LLC)
item.content:encoded:
Uniform Manifold Approximation and Projection (UMAP) is a dimension reduction technique that can be used for visualisation similarly to t-SNE, but also for general non-linear dimension reduction. The algorithm is founded on three assumptions about the data: 1. The data is uniformly distributed on a Riemannian manifold; 2. The Riemannian metric is locally constant (or can be approximated as such); 3. The manifold is locally connected. From these assumptions it is possible to model the manifold with a fuzzy topological structure. The embedding is found by searching for a low dimensional projection of the data that has the closest possible equivalent fuzzy topological structure.

Listen to the Episode!

Download
item.description:
Uniform Manifold Approximation and Projection (UMAP) is a dimension reduction technique that can be used for visualisation similarly to t-SNE, but also for general non-linear dimension reduction. The algorithm is founded on three assumptions about the data:
1. The data is uniformly distributed on a Riemannian manifold; 2. The Riemannian metric is locally constant (or can be approximated as such); 3. The manifold is locally connected.
From these assumptions it is possible to model the manifold with a fuzzy topological structure. The embedding is found by searching for a low dimensional projection of the data that has the closest possible equivalent fuzzy topological structure.
item.itunes:subtitle: Uniform Manifold Approximation and Projection
item.itunes:author: Quansight, LLC
item.itunes:summary:
Uniform Manifold Approximation and Projection (UMAP) is a dimension reduction technique that can be used for visualisation similarly to t-SNE, but also for general non-linear dimension reduction. The algorithm is founded on three assumptions about the data:
1. The data is uniformly distributed on a Riemannian manifold; 2. The Riemannian metric is locally constant (or can be approximated as such); 3. The manifold is locally connected.
From these assumptions it is possible to model the manifold with a fuzzy topological structure. The embedding is found by searching for a low dimensional projection of the data that has the closest possible equivalent fuzzy topological structure.

item.title: Episode 29: Panel
item.dc:creator: info@quansight.com (Quansight, LLC)
item.content:encoded:
Panel provides tools for easily composing widgets, plots, tables, and other viewable objects and controls into control panels, apps, and dashboards. Panel works with visualizations from Bokeh, Matplotlib, HoloViews, and other Python plotting libraries, making them instantly viewable either individually or when combined with interactive widgets that control them. Panel works equally well in Jupyter Notebooks, for creating quick data-exploration tools, or as standalone deployed apps and dashboards, and allows you to easily switch between those contexts as needed.

Listen to the Episode!

Download
item.description: Panel provides tools for easily composing widgets, plots, tables, and other viewable objects and controls into control panels, apps, and dashboards. Panel works with visualizations from Bokeh, Matplotlib, HoloViews, and other Python plotting libraries, making them instantly viewable either individually or when combined with interactive widgets that control them. Panel works equally well in Jupyter Notebooks, for creating quick data-exploration tools, or as standalone deployed apps and dashboards, and allows you to easily switch between those contexts as needed.
item.itunes:subtitle: A high-level app and dashboarding solution for Python

Panel works equally well in Jupyter Notebooks, for creating quick data-exploration tools, or as standalone deployed apps and dashboards, and allows you to easily switch between those contexts as needed.

item.title: Episode 28: Matplotlib
item.dc:creator: info@quansight.com (Quansight, LLC)
item.content:encoded:
Matplotlib is a Python 2D plotting library which produces publication quality figures in a variety of hardcopy formats and interactive environments across platforms. Matplotlib can be used in Python scripts, the Python and IPython shells, the Jupyter notebook, web application servers, and four graphical user interface toolkits.

Listen to the Episode!

Download
item.description: Matplotlib is a Python 2D plotting library which produces publication quality figures in a variety of hardcopy formats and interactive environments across platforms. Matplotlib can be used in Python scripts, the Python and IPython shells, the Jupyter notebook, web application servers, and four graphical user interface toolkits.
item.itunes:subtitle: Plotting in Python
item.itunes:author: Quansight, LLC

Matplotlib can be used in Python scripts, the Python and IPython shells, the Jupyter notebook, web application servers, and four graphical user interface toolkits.

item.title: Episode 27: OpenTeams
item.dc:creator: info@quansight.com (Quansight, LLC)
item.content:encoded:
OpenTeams brings together organizations using open source software with creators and maintainers of the software to facilitate and grow funding opportunities.

Listen to the Episode!

Download

item.itunes:summary: OpenTeams brings together organizations using open source software with creators and maintainers of the software to facilitate and grow funding opportunities.

item.title: Episode 26: Vega-Lite
item.dc:creator: info@quansight.com (Quansight, LLC)
item.content:encoded:
Vega is a declarative format for creating, saving, and sharing visualization designs. With Vega, visualizations are described in JSON, and generate interactive views using either HTML5 Canvas or SVG.

Listen to the Episode!

Download

item.title: Episode 25: Binder
item.dc:creator: info@quansight.com (Quansight, LLC)
item.content:encoded:
Have a repository full of Jupyter notebooks? With Binder, open those notebooks in an executable environment, making your code immediately reproducible by anyone, anywhere.

Listen to the Episode!

Download

item.title: Episode 24: nteract
item.dc:creator: info@quansight.com (Quansight, LLC)
item.content:encoded:
The nteract project is an ecosystem of open source tools to enable people to build their own front-ends and workflows on top of the Jupyter ecosystem.

Listen to the Episode!

Download

item.title: Episode 23: conda-forge
item.dc:creator: info@quansight.com (Quansight, LLC)
item.content:encoded:
conda-forge is community led collection of recipes, build infrastructure and distributions. Conda-forge currently build conda packages for Linux, Mac, Windows, ARM, and Power8 architectures. Conda-forge has 1400 members in its GitHub organization and >7000 repositories. The conda-forge channel has about 80 million downloads a month, and growing. Conda-forge is an official NumFOCUS project.

Listen to the Episode!

Download
item.description: conda-forge is community led collection of recipes, build infrastructure and distributions. Conda-forge currently build conda packages for Linux, Mac, Windows, ARM, and Power8 architectures. Conda-forge has 1400 members in its GitHub organization and >7000 repositories. The conda-forge channel has about 80 million downloads a month, and growing. Conda-forge is an official NumFOCUS project.
item.itunes:subtitle: Community, cross-platform packaging

The conda-forge channel has about 80 million downloads a month, and growing. Conda-forge is an official NumFOCUS project.

item.title: Episode 22: SciKit-Learn
item.dc:creator: info@quansight.com (Quansight, LLC)
item.content:encoded:
SciKit-Learn provides simple and efficient tools for data mining and data analysis which are accessible to everybody, and reusable in various contexts. It is built on NumPy, SciPy, and matplotlib.

Listen to the Episode!

Download
item.description: SciKit-Learn provides simple and efficient tools for data mining and data analysis which are accessible to everybody, and reusable in various contexts. It is built on NumPy, SciPy, and matplotlib.
item.itunes:subtitle: A Python machine learning library
item.itunes:author: Quansight, LLC
item.itunes:summary: SciKit-Learn provides simple and efficient tools for data mining and data analysis which are accessible to everybody, and reusable in various contexts. It is built on NumPy, SciPy, and matplotlib.

item.title: Episode 21: xtensor/xframe
item.dc:creator: info@quansight.com (Quansight, LLC)
item.content:encoded:
xtensor provides an extensible expression system enabling lazy broadcasting, an API following the idioms of the C++ standard library, and tools to manipulate array expressions and build upon xtensor. xtensor containers are inspired by NumPy, the Python array programming library. Adaptors for existing data structures to be plugged into our expression system can easily be written. xtensor requires a modern C++ compiler supporting C++14.

Listen to the Episode!

Download
item.description:
xtensor provides an extensible expression system enabling lazy broadcasting, an API following the idioms of the C++ standard library, and tools to manipulate array expressions and build upon xtensor. xtensor containers are inspired by NumPy, the Python array programming library. Adaptors for existing data structures to be plugged into our expression system can easily be written.
xtensor requires a modern C++ compiler supporting C++14.
item.itunes:subtitle: A C++ library meant for numerical analysis with multi-dimensional array expressions.
item.itunes:author: Quansight, LLC
item.itunes:summary:
xtensor provides an extensible expression system enabling lazy broadcasting, an API following the idioms of the C++ standard library, and tools to manipulate array expressions and build upon xtensor. xtensor containers are inspired by NumPy, the Python array programming library. Adaptors for existing data structures to be plugged into our expression system can easily be written.
xtensor requires a modern C++ compiler supporting C++14.

item.title: Episode 20: Uarray
item.dc:creator: info@quansight.com (Quansight, LLC)
item.content:encoded:
Array interface object for Python with pluggable backends and a multiple-dispatch mechanism for defining down-stream functions. CORRECTION: In the episode Hameer implied moving data from GPUs to CPUs won’t be a problem in PCIe 4,0. It’s actually in an Intel-proposed extension to PCIe 5.0.

Listen to the Episode!

Download

CORRECTION: In the episode Hameer implied moving data from GPUs to CPUs won’t be a problem in PCIe 4,0. It’s actually in an Intel-proposed extension to PCIe 5.0.

item.title: Episode 19: Pyodide
item.dc:creator: info@quansight.com (Quansight, LLC)
item.content:encoded:
It provides transparent conversion of objects between Javascript and Python. When inside a browser, this means Python has full access to the Web APIs. While closely related to the iodide project, Pyodide may be used standalone in any context where you want to run Python inside a web browser.

Listen to the Episode!

Download
item.description:
It provides transparent conversion of objects between Javascript and Python. When inside a browser, this means Python has full access to the Web APIs.
While closely related to the iodide project, Pyodide may be used standalone in any context where you want to run Python inside a web browser.
item.itunes:subtitle: The Python scientific stack, compiled to WebAssembly
item.itunes:author: Quansight, LLC
item.itunes:summary:
It provides transparent conversion of objects between Javascript and Python. When inside a browser, this means Python has full access to the Web APIs.
While closely related to the iodide project, Pyodide may be used standalone in any context where you want to run Python inside a web browser.

item.title: Episode 18: PyMC3
item.dc:creator: info@quansight.com (Quansight, LLC)
item.content:encoded:
PyMC3 is a probabilistic programming package for Python that allows users to fit Bayesian models using a variety of numerical methods, most notably Markov chain Monte Carlo (MCMC) and variational inference (VI).

Listen to the Episode!

Download
item.description: PyMC3 is a probabilistic programming package for Python that allows users to fit Bayesian models using a variety of numerical methods, most notably Markov chain Monte Carlo (MCMC) and variational inference (VI).
item.itunes:subtitle: Probabilistic Programming in Python
item.itunes:author: Quansight, LLC
item.itunes:summary: PyMC3 is a probabilistic programming package for Python that allows users to fit Bayesian models using a variety of numerical methods, most notably Markov chain Monte Carlo (MCMC) and variational inference (VI).

item.title: Episode 17: TensorFlow
item.dc:creator: info@quansight.com (Quansight, LLC)
item.content:encoded:
TensorFlow is an end-to-end open source platform for machine learning. It has a comprehensive, flexible ecosystem of tools, libraries and community resources that lets researchers push the state-of-the-art in ML and developers easily build and deploy ML powered applications.

Listen to the Episode!

Download
item.description: TensorFlow is an end-to-end open source platform for machine learning. It has a comprehensive, flexible ecosystem of tools, libraries and community resources that lets researchers push the state-of-the-art in ML and developers easily build and deploy ML powered applications.
item.itunes:subtitle: An open source machine learning library for research and production.
item.itunes:author: Quansight, LLC
item.itunes:summary: TensorFlow is an end-to-end open source platform for machine learning. It has a comprehensive, flexible ecosystem of tools, libraries and community resources that lets researchers push the state-of-the-art in ML and developers easily build and deploy ML powered applications.

item.title: Episode 16: Chainer
item.dc:creator: info@quansight.com (Quansight, LLC)
item.content:encoded:
Chainer is a powerful, flexible and intuitive deep learning framework. Chainer supports CUDA computation. It only requires a few lines of code to leverage a GPU. It also runs on multiple GPUs with little effort. Chainer supports various network architectures including feed-forward nets, convnets, recurrent nets and recursive nets. It also supports per-batch architectures. Forward computation can include any control flow statements of Python without lacking the ability of backpropagation. It makes code intuitive and easy to debug.

Listen to the Episode!

Download
item.description: Chainer is a powerful, flexible and intuitive deep learning framework. Chainer supports CUDA computation. It only requires a few lines of code to leverage a GPU. It also runs on multiple GPUs with little effort. Chainer supports various network architectures including feed-forward nets, convnets, recurrent nets and recursive nets. It also supports per-batch architectures. Forward computation can include any control flow statements of Python without lacking the ability of backpropagation. It makes code intuitive and easy to debug.
item.itunes:subtitle: Powerful, flexible and intuitive deep learning framework
item.itunes:author: Quansight, LLC
item.itunes:summary: Chainer is a powerful, flexible and intuitive deep learning framework. Chainer supports CUDA computation. It only requires a few lines of code to leverage a GPU. It also runs on multiple GPUs with little effort. Chainer supports various network architectures including feed-forward nets, convnets, recurrent nets and recursive nets. It also supports per-batch architectures. Forward computation can include any control flow statements of Python without lacking the ability of backpropagation. It makes code intuitive and easy to debug.

item.title: Episode 15: Numba
item.dc:creator: info@quansight.com (Quansight, LLC)
item.content:encoded:
Numba is an open source JIT compiler that translates a subset of Python and NumPy code into fast machine code. Numba translates Python functions to optimized machine code at runtime using the Industry-standard LLVM compiler library. Numba-compiled numerical algorithms in Python can approach the speeds of C or FORTRAN. Users do not need to replacethe Python interpreter, run a separate compilation step, or even have a C/C++ compiler installed. Applying one of the Numba decorators to a Python function is all that is needed.

Listen to the Episode!

Download
item.description: Numba is an open source JIT compiler that translates a subset of Python and NumPy code into fast machine code. Numba translates Python functions to optimized machine code at runtime using the Industry-standard LLVM compiler library. Numba-compiled numerical algorithms in Python can approach the speeds of C or FORTRAN. Users do not need to replacethe Python interpreter, run a separate compilation step, or even have a C/C++ compiler installed. Applying one of the Numba decorators to a Python function is all that is needed.
item.itunes:subtitle: Python code, fast

item.title: Episode 14: ITK
item.dc:creator: info@quansight.com (Quansight, LLC)
item.content:encoded:
ITK is an open-source, cross-platform system that provides developers with an extensive suite of software tools for image analysis. Developed through extreme programming methodologies, ITK employs leading-edge algorithms for registering and segmenting multidimensional data.

Listen to the Episode!

item.title: Episode 13: Jupyter Ecosystem
item.dc:creator: info@quansight.com (Quansight, LLC)
item.content:encoded:
Project Jupyter exists to develop open-source software, open-standards, and services for interactive computing across dozens of programming languages. The Jupyter Notebook is an open-source web application that allows you to create and share documents that contain live code, equations, visualizations and narrative text. Uses include: data cleaning and transformation, numerical simulation, statistical modeling, data visualization, machine learning, and much more.

Listen to the Episode!

Download

Uses include: data cleaning and transformation, numerical simulation, statistical modeling, data visualization, machine learning, and much more.

item.title: Episode 11: Dask
item.dc:creator: info@quansight.com (Quansight, LLC)
item.content:encoded:
Dask provides advanced parallelism for analytics, enabling performance at scale for the tools you love. Dask is open source and freely available. It is developed in coordination with other community projects like Numpy, Pandas, and SciKit-Learn.

Listen to the Episode!

Download

item.title: Episode 10: PyData/Sparse
item.dc:creator: info@quansight.com (Quansight, LLC)
item.content:encoded:
The aim of PyData/Sparse is to create sparse containers that implement the ndarray interface. Traditionally in the PyData ecosystem, sparse arrays have been provided by the scipy.sparse submodule. All containers there depend on and emulate the numpy.matrix interface. This means that they are limited to two dimensions and also do not work well in places where numpy.ndarray would work. PyData/Sparse is well on its way to replacing scipy.sparse as the de-facto sparse array implementation in the PyData ecosystem.

Listen to the Episode!

Download
item.description:
The aim of PyData/Sparse is to create sparse containers that implement the ndarray interface. Traditionally in the PyData ecosystem, sparse arrays have been provided by the scipy.sparse submodule. All containers there depend on and emulate the numpy.matrix interface. This means that they are limited to two dimensions and also do not work well in places where numpy.ndarray would work.
PyData/Sparse is well on its way to replacing scipy.sparse as the de-facto sparse array implementation in the PyData ecosystem.
item.itunes:subtitle: Sparse arrays of arbitrary dimension
item.itunes:author: Quansight, LLC
item.itunes:summary:

item.title: Episode 9: Datashader
item.dc:creator: info@quansight.com (Quansight, LLC)
item.content:encoded:
Datashader is a graphics pipeline system for creating meaningful representations of large datasets quickly and flexibly. Datashader breaks the creation of images into a series of explicit steps that allow computations to be done on intermediate representations. This approach allows accurate and effective visualizations to be produced automatically without trial-and-error parameter tuning, and also makes it simple for data scientists to focus on particular data and relationships of interest in a principled way.

Listen to the Episode!

Download

This approach allows accurate and effective visualizations to be produced automatically without trial-and-error parameter tuning, and also makes it simple for data scientists to focus on particular data and relationships of interest in a principled way.
item.itunes:subtitle: Turns even the largest data into images, accurately.

item.title: Episode 8: SciPy
item.dc:creator: info@quansight.com (Quansight, LLC)
item.content:encoded:
SciPy is open-source software for mathematics, science, and engineering. It includes modules for statistics, optimization, integration, linear algebra, Fourier transforms, signal and image processing, ODE solvers, and more. SciPy provides many user-friendly and efficient numerical routines such as for numerical integration and optimization. SciPy runs on all popular operating systems, is easy to use, and powerful enough to be depended upon by the world's leading scientists & engineers.

Listen to the Episode!

Download

It includes modules for statistics, optimization, integration, linear algebra, Fourier transforms, signal and image processing, ODE solvers, and more. SciPy runs on all popular operating systems, is easy to use, and powerful enough to be depended upon by the world's leading scientists & engineers.

item.title: Episode 7: GeoViews
item.dc:creator: info@quansight.com (Quansight, LLC)
item.content:encoded:
GeoViews is a Python library that makes it easy to explore and visualize geographical, meteorological, and oceanographic datasets, such as those used in weather, climate, and remote sensing research. GeoViews is built on the HoloViews library for building flexible visualizations of multidimensional data. GeoViews adds a family of geographic plot types based on the Cartopy library, plotted using either the Matplotlib or Bokeh packages. With GeoViews, you can now work easily and naturally with large, multidimensional geographic datasets, instantly visualizing any subset or combination of them, while always being able to access the raw data underlying any plot.

Listen to the Episode!

Download

With GeoViews, you can now work easily and naturally with large, multidimensional geographic datasets, instantly visualizing any subset or combination of them, while always being able to access the raw data underlying any plot.

item.title: Episode 4: PyViz
item.dc:creator: info@quansight.com (Quansight, LLC)
item.content:encoded:
PyViz is a set of examples that help you see how various Python packages can work together to solve a huge range of visualization problems, from common situations to tricky special cases. Although there is an installable package named pyviz, it’s valuable mainly for its dependencies, which are a coherent set of libraries designed to work well together. There is almost no code actually in PyViz, apart from the examples in the tutorials.

Listen to the Episode!

Download
item.description: PyViz is a set of examples that help you see how various Python packages can work together to solve a huge range of visualization problems, from common situations to tricky special cases. Although there is an installable package named pyviz, it’s valuable mainly for its dependencies, which are a coherent set of libraries designed to work well together. There is almost no code actually in PyViz, apart from the examples in the tutorials.
item.itunes:subtitle: A coordinated effort to make data visualization in Python easier to use, easier to learn, and more powerful

There is almost no code actually in PyViz, apart from the examples in the tutorials.

item.title: Episode 3: SymPy
item.dc:creator: info@quansight.com (Quansight, LLC)
item.content:encoded:
SymPy is a Python library for symbolic mathematics. It aims to become a full-featured computer algebra system (CAS) while keeping the code as simple as possible in order to be comprehensible and easily extensible. SymPy is written entirely in Python. All purely symbolic mathematical computation is in scope for SymPy.

Listen to the Episode!

Download

It aims to become a full-featured computer algebra system (CAS) while keeping the code as simple as possible in order to be comprehensible and easily extensible. SymPy is written entirely in Python. All purely symbolic mathematical computation is in scope for SymPy.
item.itunes:subtitle: A Python library for symbolic mathematics

All purely symbolic mathematical computation is in scope for SymPy.

item.title: Episode 2: XND
item.dc:creator: info@quansight.com (Quansight, LLC)
item.content:encoded:
XND is an extensible framework of C libraries and Python modules for handling typed memory blocks. XND recreates the foundations of NumPy as a number of smaller libraries, combining the lessons learned in the past twenty years of array computing in Python with the needs of newer applications. XND's type system is more general than NumPy's and allows unpacking arbitrarily nested Python type hierarchies directly to memory. XND's computational kernels are multimethods and can be generated and inserted into modular lookup tables at runtime. This opens the possibility for a large variety of applications written in different languages to use XND as a container backend. Ongoing work connects XND to Numba, Lapack/MKL and the CUDA kernel libraries. There is interest in integrating XND with a variety of libraries like Dask, xarray, Numba, Chainer, PyTorch, Tensorflow, PyMC4, TVM/NNVM, Plasma Store, Apache Arrow, and Tensor Comprehensions.

Listen to the Episode!

Download

XND recreates the foundations of NumPy as a number of smaller libraries, combining the lessons learned in the past twenty years of array computing in Python with the needs of newer applications. XND's type system is more general than NumPy's and allows unpacking arbitrarily nested Python type hierarchies directly to memory.
XND's computational kernels are multimethods and can be generated and inserted into modular lookup tables at runtime. This opens the possibility for a large variety of applications written in different languages to use XND as a container backend.
Ongoing work connects XND to Numba, Lapack/MKL and the CUDA kernel libraries. There is interest in integrating XND with a variety of libraries like Dask, xarray, Numba, Chainer, PyTorch, Tensorflow, PyMC4, TVM/NNVM, Plasma Store, Apache Arrow, and Tensor Comprehensions.

item.title: Episode 1: Spyder
item.dc:creator: info@quansight.com (Quansight, LLC)
item.content:encoded:
NOTE: Please forgive the technical difficulties we had in recording this episode. Carlos had some connectivity issues. We are releasing this episode because we still want to bring you all of the news about Spyder! Spyder is a powerful scientific environment written in Python, for Python, and designed by and for scientists, engineers and data analysts. It offers a unique combination of the advanced editing, analysis, debugging, and profiling functionality of a comprehensive development tool with the data exploration, interactive execution, deep inspection, and beautiful visualization capabilities of a scientific package. Beyond its many built-in features, its abilities can be extended even further via its plugin system and API. Furthermore, Spyder can also be used as a PyQt5 extension library, allowing developers to build upon its functionality and embed its components, such as the interactive console, in their own PyQt software.

Listen to the Episode!

Download

Beyond its many built-in features, its abilities can be extended even further via its plugin system and API. item.title: Episode 0: Bokeh
item.dc:creator: info@quansight.com (Quansight, LLC)
item.content:encoded:
This episode features Bokeh, which is a web-based and interactive visualization library for Python. Its goal is to provide elegant, concise construction of versatile graphics, and to extend this capability with high-performance interactivity over very large or streaming datasets. Bokeh can help anyone who would like to quickly and easily create interactive plots, dashboards, and data applications.

Listen to the Episode!

Download

Bokeh can help anyone who would like to quickly and easily create interactive plots, dashboards, and data applications.
